channel.title: inheritance on The R Blog
channel.description: Recent content in inheritance on The R Blog

item.title: `class(.) == *`, part 2
item.description: Findings about the (mis)use of class(.) == * This is basically “part 2” of my blog earlier this month, telling you that “When you think class(.) == *, think again!”. There were some reactions on twitter, with questions, some relevant.. More seriously, there were also reactions to my R-devel mailing list post … FIXME (wrong URL!): … in the mean time, R-devel, the development version of R, as available via subversion, from (ETH Zurich–hosted) https://svn.

item.title: When you think `class(.) == *`, think again!
item.description: short lines !! -- Historical relict: R matrix is not an array In a recent discussion on the R-devel mailing list, in a thread started on July 8, head.matrix can return 1000s of columns – limit to n or add new argument? Michael Chirico and then Gabe Becker where proposing to generalize the head() and tail() utility functions, and Gabe noted that current (pre R-4.x.y) head() would not treat array specially.
